Package se.swedenconnect.ca.engine.revocation.crl

Class CRLIssuerModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.swedenconnect.ca.engine.revocation.crl.CRLIssuerModel
  • public class CRLIssuerModel
extends Object
    Model holding configuration data for a CRL issuer.
    Author:
    Stefan Santesson (stefan@idsec.se)

    • Constructor Detail

      • CRLIssuerModel

        public CRLIssuerModel​(org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder issuerCertificate,
                      String algorithm,
                      Duration validityDuration,
                      String distributionPointUrl)
        Constructs a CRL issuer model. The number of validity hours can be overwritten with a more suitable type and amount by setting expiryOffsetType and expiryOffsetAmount. E.g. if the "validHours" parameter here is set to 1 and expirtyOffsetType is changed to Calendar.YEAR, then the CRL will expire in 1 year.

        Note also that one CRLIssuerModel will issue just one CRL at one publication location. If other CRL:s are issued to other locations, they need their own CRL issuer model. This is because the CRLDP location is written into each CRL.

        Parameters:
        issuerCertificate - issuer certificates of the CRL issuing CA
        algorithm - CRL signing algorithm
        validityDuration - the duration a CRL is valid
        distributionPointUrl - the URL where the URL will be published

      • CRLIssuerModel

        public CRLIssuerModel​(org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder issuerCertificate,
                      String algorithm,
                      Duration validityDuration,
                      String distributionPointUrl,
                      Duration maxDurationBeforeCRLUpgrade)
        Constructs a CRL issuer model. The number of validity hours can be overwritten with a more suitable type and amount by setting expiryOffsetType and expiryOffsetAmount. E.g. if the "validHours" parameter here is set to 1 and expirtyOffsetType is changed to Calendar.YEAR, then the CRL will expire in 1 year.

        Note also that one CRLIssuerModel will issue just one CRL at one publication location. If other CRL:s are issued to other locations, they need their own CRL issuer model. This is because the CRLDP location is written into each CRL.

        Parameters:
        issuerCertificate - issuer certificates of the CRL issuing CA
        algorithm - CRL signing algorithm
        validityDuration - the duration a CRL is valid
        distributionPointUrl - the URL where the URL will be published
        maxDurationBeforeCRLUpgrade - aximum time after CRL issuance when issuance of a new CRL will be enforced (regardless of next Update declaration)
